page.title: 03Barbauchlaw Burn, Blackridge
page.content: In 1924 a{foot-bridge}was built by the Motherwell Bridge Company. By the {burn}at the foot-bridge there was a {mill. }It was called the {clattering-mill. It had a tall house and garden. There is a sign at the side of the burn which says that if anyone is caught putting litter in the burn they will be fined Â£25. At the railway-bridge to the quarry the burn is sinking sand. There are minnows in the burn. Before the burn was cleaned out a local farmer's field was flooded. Now the burn is not flooded. The farmer now grows silage in the field . The burn starts at {Forrestburn Reservoir}and finishes at the{River Avon.
